meanings.definition: A large group of people transported by bus.
meanings.sent1: During the field trip, three busloads of students visited the museum.
meanings.sent2: The stadium was filled with busloads of excited fans ready to cheer for their team.
meanings.sent3: The busloads of tourists all wore matching hats, making them easy to spot in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: As the busloads of protesters arrived, their chants echoed through the streets.
meanings.sent5: The image of busloads of children laughing and playing together will always stay with me.

meanings.definition: The amount of people that can fit on a bus.
meanings.sent1: The bus driver counted the busloads of passengers before departing.
meanings.sent2: The busloads of commuters squeezed into the crowded bus during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit a busloads of luggage into the tiny overhead compartment was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The busloads of groceries were too heavy for one person to carry.
meanings.sent5: The busloads of students waiting at the bus stop eagerly chatted about their day.
